item.description:
After a break, it's time for another in the series of FREE classical music concerts!

This evening's program features The NEC's Director of Orchestras, Hugh Wolff conducting 2 Walton Pieces and Brahms serenade #1.

For more details about the concert, go to http://necmusic.edu/n...

The concert starts at 8pm, but let's meet up at 7:30, so the group has a chance to get good seats and socialize before the concert. We usually end up sitting in the left side of the back full row of the center floor section, since this affords a good view of the entire orchestra, is open to the ceiling, and is easy to describe and find.

Directions to Jordan Hall:
The hall is located at the corner of Huntington and Gainsborough streets, about a block south of the Symphony T stop on the Green Line. Look for the building with the YMCA sign on top of it--it's in that building. The main entrance is reached from Gainsborough Street.


This evening's program will include:


  • Walton's Overture Portsmouth Point
  • Walton's Violin Concerto, Tessa Lark soloist Listen to the 1st movement here
  • Brahms Serenade 1 Listen to the 1st movement here
item.how_to_find_us: I will stand in the lobby until 7:45, after which I will join the group, either in the left section of the main floor or upstairs to the left-middle balcony section (if it's open.)
item.name: Classical Concert Series: Wolff conducts Walton and Brahms
